so_62869712: unzip foo.zip

#!/bin/bash
mkdir data
cd data || exit 1
wget http://187.191.75.115/gobmx/salud/datos_abiertos/datos_abiertos_covid19.zip && unzip datos_abiertos_covid19.zip

Explanations about Options.-p:
extract files to pipe (stdout). Nothing but the file data is sent to stdout , and
 the files are always extracted in binary format, just as they are stored (no
 conversions).

Explanations about Options.-d:
Always create a containing directory for the contents of the unpacked archive. By
 default, a directory is created if there is more than one top-level file or folder.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: List the contents of a tar file
Top-3 Similar Questions: so_24355289: Unzip a single file in a tbz archive
so_56295300: Access to zipped files without unzipping them
Top-3 Scripts:
su_561089: #!/bin/bash

read dirloc

cd $dirloc

for file in *.tar.7z
        do
                7za x -so $file | tar -xf -
        done

so_24355289: tar xjf archive.tbz filename

bzip2 -dc archive.tbz | tar xvf - filename

tar tjf archive.tbz

Explanations about Options.-x:
Extract files from an archive. Arguments are optional. When given, they specify
 names of the archive members to be extracted.
Explanations about Options.-t:
List the contents of an archive. Arguments are optional. When given, they specify
 the names of the members to list.
